displayName.text: ITC Grand Chola, a Luxury Collection Hotel, Chennai

places.shortFormattedAddress: 63, Mount Rd, Little Mount, Guindy, Chennai

editorialSummary.text: Palatial choice offering elegant rooms & luxe suites with multiple dining options, plus shopping.

text.text:
Stayed @ ITC Grand Chola for 4N/5D during July 2025 while on a business trip to Chennai.

Impressed by the grand architecture, property amenities (600+ rooms, services apartments, many restaurants with specialised cuisine, swimming pool, spa, lounge, wellness centre / gym, etc.), sprawling lawns, spacious rooms, artisanal ice-cream place, fabelle chocolates store and courteous staff!
There were multiple specialty restaurants from Indian to Pan Asian, Indian, Italian, and more.

On all the 5 days, the breakfast buffet was a highlight-lavish, well-balanced with South/North Indian and Western options. The dinner spread, while decent, leaned more heavily on Indian options.

One suggestion: While items are clearly labelled with allergen info, I expected clearer separation between vegetarian and non-vegetarian items, especially for people with allergies. For instance, pancakes (with egg) and eggless waffles were placed side by side, with a shared serving tong - increases cross contamination risks. As someone with a severe egg allergy, this was very concerning for me. While the staff always prepared fresh waffles for me on request, the arrangement / layout of dishes didnt change over the 5 days I had breakfast - i expect better allergen awareness and caution from a luxury property.

Special mention to Sayantan @ front desk for a smooth experience, Susmita for her personal touch / calls about my experience, Abhisek who served us (during dinner on 7/10). Thanks team!

Overall, it was a memorable stay - but a bit more attention to detail and timely accommodation of guest requests would elevate the experience further!

Room was comfortable and sufficiently spacious. The hotel has a Chola style architecture and sculptures on the inside - really good ambience. The hotel provided complimentary banana chips made in coconut oil which were really nice. Service was excellent. Swimming pool and gym facilities were well kept.
Was here for an office event. Food services were decent, beverages were really good.
Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

text.text:
My stay at ITC Grand Chola in Chennai was an exceptional experience, marked by luxury, comfort, and world-class hospitality. The rooms were truly opulent spacious, elegantly designed, and equipped with every modern amenity one could ask for. From the plush bedding to the high-tech in-room controls, every detail reflected attention to luxury and convenience. The blend of traditional South Indian architecture with contemporary touches made the space feel both grand and welcoming.

One of the absolute highlights of my stay was the food. Every meal was a culinary delight. The variety and richness of flavors across their multiple in-house restaurants were simply outstanding. Whether it was the lavish South Indian breakfast spread, authentic Chettinad cuisine, or the perfectly cooked international dishes, everything was fresh, beautifully presented, and absolutely delicious. The service at the dining venues was equally impeccable warm, attentive, and knowledgeable staff who went out of their way to make sure we had the best experience.

The overall ambience of the property from the stunning lobby to the serene pool area and grand corridors exudes elegance. It’s clear that this hotel doesn’t just provide accommodation but a luxurious experience rooted in Indian hospitality.

Highly recommended for anyone visiting Chennai, whether for business or leisure.

The room furnishings especially towels are not fresh looking anymore and are also threadbare.

text.text:
ITC Grand Chola, Chennai

ITC Grand Chola is a true luxury property with a grand presence. While the rooms offered comfort, the ambience felt somewhat subdued due to the dark-colored furniture and décor, which made it a bit challenging to fully relax.

On the culinary front, the experience was truly exceptional. The dining options were remarkable, and we thoroughly enjoyed the flavorful, finger-licking dishes that ITC Hotels are renowned for. Overall, a memorable stay with standout dining experiences, though the room ambience could benefit from a lighter, more relaxing touch.

text.text:
Five-Star Experience at Lemon Tree Hotel, Guindy!
I recently stayed at Lemon Tree Hotel in Guindy with my life partner, and it was a truly wonderful experience. From the moment we checked in, we felt safe and secure—something that really matters when traveling as a couple.

The swimming pool was clean and well-maintained, perfect for a relaxing dip. The reception staff, especially the girls, were very welcoming and helpful. A special shout-out to Mr. Mohan at the front office—his warm and friendly attitude made us feel right at home.

Thanks to the amazing service and hospitality, we’re already looking forward to visiting again and again. Highly recommended!

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

Thank you for creating a place that feels so special. We will carry this experience with us for a long time.

Thanks

text.text:
Stay court hotel is just walkable distance (within 1km) from the chennai central railway station). I stayed at the staycourt hotel for 2 days.
The stay was pretty okay for the price they offer. The staffs were welcoming and polite.
The room was a bit congested though it was clean. Ac and tv were in working condition. Also had a decent sized mirror with light. The bathroom was also clean but at times a bad odour was present. Hot water facility is there.
Toiletries provided included towel and soap. Dental kit, shaving kit, etc would be provided upon request. They don't provide complementary bottled water but I think they have water purifier available.
The hotel doesnt have a restaurant, but one can order food online. Also there are restaurants like a2b, murugans idly, etc near by.

To conclude, the stay was okay for 2 days for the price they provide.

text.text:
Hotel Review: Disappointing Experience – Not Worth the Five-Star Tag

I recently stayed at this hotel for two nights, expecting a true five-star experience based on its classification and pricing. Unfortunately, it fell far short of expectations in almost every aspect.

Despite the high price, the services and amenities felt more like a three-star property. There was no lounge area, no lawn space, and no spa, which are basic features you'd expect from any upscale hotel. The room itself was quite compact, and to make matters worse, the mini-fridge wasn’t working. I informed the staff two to three times, but it was never resolved during my stay.

Basic necessities were also missing—no hand towels were provided, and the food quality was subpar. The buffet for breakfast, lunch, and dinner lacked variety and taste, making dining a rather disappointing experience.

Overall, the hotel does not live up to its five-star status. With its limited amenities, lack of attention to guest concerns, and poor food quality, I would rate it more accurately as a three-star property. Definitely not worth the premium pricing.

Only good thing is behavior of staff, very polite and courteous.

text.text:
The Park Hotel Chennai is an excellent choice if you are visiting the city for a US visa appointment. Its most significant advantage is its location, it is just a short walk or a 2-minute drive from the US Consulate and the Visa Application Center, making it incredibly convenient for visa-related work. The proximity reduces travel stress on the day of the appointment. The highlight is hotel’s clean and comfortable rooms, supportive and prompt staff, and good amenities such as spa services, pool, and on-site dining. The property’s ambience is modern yet welcoming, and the staff are known to be helpful, which can be especially comforting during a possibly tense visa trip. If you’re traveling for visa appointments, then i would say it’s “worth every money spent.”

Overall, for those needing to visit the Consulate, The Park Chennai offers a hassle-free and comfortable experience, and its location is one of the best you will find for this purpose.

⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐
Stayed at The Park Hotel Chennai for the first time and it was a truly delightful experience. The hotel perfectly blends luxury with comfort. From the moment I checked in, the staff was courteous and attentive, making me feel instantly welcomed.

The room was spotless, well-furnished, and had all the modern amenities one would expect from a 5-star property. The location is excellent — centrally placed, making it easy to access major spots in the city. The in-house restaurants offered a wide variety of cuisines, and every meal was a treat!

Highly recommend this hotel for both business and leisure travelers. Exceptional hospitality, stylish interiors, and a peaceful atmosphere — The Park Chennai definitely lives up to its reputation.

Our stay at the property was truly enjoyable and exceeded expectations. The hospitality and service were commendable, and we would like to extend our special thanks to Ms. Catherine and Ms. Sujitha at the reception for their warm welcome and consistent support throughout our stay. Their professionalism and attentiveness made a positive difference in our experience.

The only suggestion for improvement would be regarding the cleanliness and maintenance of the toilet area, as we noticed an occasional foul smell. Additionally, it would be helpful to place dry floor mats at the bathroom entrance to ensure better hygiene and safety. Implementing these small changes would further enhance the overall guest experience.

text.text:
Had an amazing experience at the Park for their lunch buffet! The spread was extensive with a great mix of cuisines – from fresh salads and appetizers to hearty mains and indulgent desserts. Every dish was well-prepared and flavorful. The ambiance was elegant yet comfortable, making it perfect for a relaxed afternoon meal.

Special mention to Imran for his exceptional service – he was attentive, warm, and made sure our table had everything we needed. His hospitality really elevated the entire dining experience.

The staff overall were polite and professional, and the live counters were a highlight. The presentation of the dishes added a premium touch.

Excellent value for money and a must-visit for anyone who enjoys a wide variety of quality food in a classy setting. Will definitely come back!

text.text:
Avoid this hotel unless location is your only priority.

Stayed at Ibis Chennai City Centre for 9 nights — and it was a very disappointing experience. The A/C is locked at 24°C, and the cooling was terrible throughout our stay. No help with luggage, even during check-in or check-out. What made it worse was the rude and unhelpful reception staff — zero customer service.

The only good thing was the location — great for shopping and restaurants. But that alone doesn’t make up for the poor service, discomfort, and lack of basic facilities. Definitely not worth the price. Look elsewhere if you want a comfortable and respectful stay.

editorialSummary.text: Modern quarters in a contemporary hotel with dining options & a bar, plus 2 pools & a spa.

text.text:
We arrived in Chennai in March 2025 and had a very enjoyable stay in this hotel. Service was excellent. Many options for food and drinks as they had about three restaurants within. Breakfast and dinner spread was so varied and widespread; great choices for non vegetarians (their mutton curry with thosai was amazing ) that which we did not enjoy in other hotels that we stayed on our two week trip to Trichy, Pondicherry, Goa and Cochin. Chennai GRT outdid even the Taj Fort Aquada in Goa by leaps and bounds in every aspect; service, ambience, rooms, fast lifts, food and driver’s parking.
As for service we wish to mention:
Kathir , Restaurant Manager & Sathish, Senior Executive, who were ever so attentive to both my husband every time  we were in the restaurant for our meals. My husband, who is English, wasn’t familiar with the various Indian dishes and had his preferences but they were so caring and ensured his every request was catered to. It is senior management such as them who enhance the experience for us customers and keep us coming back.
We want to thank Aparajita, Reception Staff who checked us in so smoothly and gave a few gift cards to enjoy in the hotel. Aparajita even walked us to the room to ensure it met with our comfort.She was very engaging, soft spoken, charming and stopped to check on us any time she met us in the foyer.
All in all we hardly had any meals outside of this hotel as hygiene was our priority and GRT, Chennai met that. If we visit Chennai again, this definitely be where we will stay!

Chandrika & Peter Nelson from Malaysia.

This 5 star hotel is located on the main road and it is easy to find the place. They have well trained staff who will guide you from parking to other services in the hotel.
I have visited this place for the conference and the banquet hall is big and can accommodate 100-150 people . There is good space and the refreshment as sugarcane juice is served. The water bottles were placed on each table . The food is served near the banquet hall and they have a good variety of vegetarian dishes in the buffet and 2-3 items in non vegetarian. The food is good and the staff were on their toes to serve the same .
The dessert counter is also good.
Overall a good place to attend a conference and have dinner.

text.text:
Our stay at Grand Chennai by GRT Hotels was nothing short of exceptional.
From the moment we arrived until the moment we left, everything exceeded our expectations.

The staff were truly outstanding – warm, professional, and always ready to help with a smile. They made us feel genuinely welcome, like we were part of a family.
The cleanliness was impeccable. Every corner of the hotel was spotless and fresh.
The food was simply amazing – flavorful, varied, and beautifully presented. Every meal was a delight!

What truly touched our hearts was how attached our children became to the place.
When we told them it was time to leave, they were genuinely sad – they didn’t want to go! That says more than words ever could about how special this hotel is.

Thank you to everyone at Grand Chennai by GRT Hotels for creating such a beautiful experience.
You’ve raised the bar for hospitality, and we look forward to returning again, God willing.

With heartfelt gratitude,
Jamal & Family

Jamal & Family

text.text:
An outstanding experience from start to finish at the Hyatt Regency Chennai!

The hotel is in a prime location — central, convenient, and easy to get around. The property itself is spacious, clean, and very well maintained, with a strong sense of safety and comfort throughout.

The rooms are large, spotless, and thoughtfully designed, making for a truly relaxing stay. The dining options are fantastic, with multiple restaurants offering a great variety of delicious cuisines. The bar area is a great highlight, with live performances and a vibrant yet classy atmosphere that adds to the overall experience.

I also made use of the spa and gym facilities, both of which are top-notch. The spa services were excellent, and the gym is well-equipped and clean — perfect for staying on track while traveling.

What truly sets this hotel apart is the team of people working here. Every single staff member I interacted with — from the general manager and front desk team, to the concierge, waitresses, housekeeping staff, security guards, chefs, and kitchen team — was courteous, professional, and genuinely warm. You can tell there is a real culture of hospitality here. Everyone made an effort to ensure guests feel welcome, comfortable, and well cared for.

A big thank you to everyone at the Hyatt Regency Chennai for making my stay so memorable. Highly recommended whether you’re here for business or leisure!

text.text: They claim to be a 4 star hotel but in reality it’s not worth even 1 star. We had to change 4 rooms before getting a decent one. Either their flush was not working, or fridge was missing, or room was stinking and more. After 1 hour lunch break they gave us a duplex, which was spacious but with no water in washbasin, with broken fridge, no kettle and no tea coffee station, no toilet paper. We had to call staff to fix it and it took another hour. So instead of checking in at 2pm, we actually got our room ready at 5pm.   Moreover, we got a call from their receptionist who asked us to order something from their restaurant, Tandoori Tamasha. Unfortunately, we listened to his advice and as a result we got a wrong order and food came in plastic containers and the bill was presented with container and service charges! It’s surprising how bad a hotel management can be.

text.text:
Currently Staying – Not a Great Choice for Families

I’m currently staying at Ilara Hotels & Spa, and honestly, it hasn’t been a comfortable experience, especially if you're here with family or friends.

We were told that for more than two people, the extra person could sleep in the living room on the sofa. But the living room has no fan or AC, which makes it extremely uncomfortable. The AC and faucet in our main room aren't working properly either.

When we raised these issues, the staff just asked us to adjust for the night, saying they might give us a different room the next day. But today, they’ve changed the story, saying all rooms are the same and only offering a fan as a fix.

We’ve ended up squeezing into one room, trying to manage without basic comfort. So far, it’s been disappointing. I wouldn't suggest this place if you're looking for a relaxed and hassle-free family stay.

Another disappointment: the “spa” mentioned in the hotel’s name is currently non-operational for the next two months. If you're booking with the expectation of a relaxing spa experience, you’ll be let down. The name is quite misleading in that sense.

text.text:
Booked for a suite room, expecting a higher standard of comfort and service. However, I regret to share that the experience did not meet the expected suite standards due to the following issues:
1. The toilet closet was leaking after every flush. While the staff promptly shifted me to another room upon complaint, such issues shouldn't occur in a suite category room.
2. The A/C unit in the room was excessively noisy, indicating a need for proper maintenance and servicing to ensure dust-free, effective cooling.
3. Although the room size was spacious enough to accommodate three people, the room had a persistent unpleasant odor, which affected overall comfort.
4. The bed covers, pillow covers, window curtains, and even the towels had a stale and unpleasant odor. This suggests inadequate laundering or storage.
5. Water supply was disrupted in the middle of the night, and despite multiple calls to reception, no one responded. I had to report it in person to get it resolved.
6. During my three-night stay, no housekeeping staff approached to offer room cleaning or replenishment of basic consumables such as bottled water, toiletries, towels, or tea/milk refills. This lack of daily maintenance was disappointing.
7. The dress & shoe closet was not cleaned properly and did not have any hangers, making it unusable for organizing clothes/shoe during the stay.

text.text:
I stayed at this hotel recently and honestly, it was not a pleasant experience. The rooms were very small and felt quite suffocating. There was barely enough space to move or keep luggage comfortably. The most disappointing part was the condition of the floors — they were sticky and felt unclean, which made it very uncomfortable to walk around, even with slippers.

Housekeeping was just average, but the cleaning felt rushed and not thorough. Basic cleanliness and hygiene should be a priority, especially in hospitality, but it was clearly lacking here.

The room also had a weird damp smell that didn’t go away, and the overall ambiance was dull. The photos online were quite misleading compared to what was actually offered. Even the bed linens didn’t feel fresh or properly washed.

Honestly, I wouldn’t recommend this place unless the management takes serious steps to improve hygiene and overall upkeep.

I had a wonderful experience staying at The Grand One Hotel. The location is extremely convenient, especially for those visiting Apollo Hospital, as it’s just a short walk away. The rooms were spotlessly clean, well-maintained, and equipped with all the basic amenities needed for a comfortable stay.

What truly stood out was the hospitality of the staff—they were polite, helpful, and always ready to assist with a smile. The check-in process was smooth, and housekeeping was prompt and efficient. Even though the hotel doesn’t have an in-house restaurant, room service was available and there were plenty of dining options nearby.

The hotel also offers free Wi-Fi, 24-hour front desk support, and ample parking space, which added to the convenience. I would highly recommend The Grand One to anyone looking for a clean, budget-friendly, and centrally located stay in Chennai.

The rooms were spotlessly clean, well-maintained, and equipped with all the basic amenities needed for a comfortable stay.

What truly stood out was the hospitality of the staff—they were polite, helpful, and always ready to assist with a smile. The check-in process was smooth, and housekeeping was prompt and efficient. Even though the hotel doesn’t have an in-house restaurant, room service was available and there were plenty of dining options nearby.

The hotel also offers free Wi-Fi, 24-hour front desk support, and ample parking space, which added to the convenience. I would highly recommend The Grand One to anyone looking for a clean, budget-friendly, and centrally located stay in Chennai.

text.text:
We had the pleasure of staying at Grand One Tower – a true Business Class Hotel in Chennai – not just once, but three times last year, and every time felt like a home away from home.

Their 24×7 check-in and check-out facility is a huge advantage, especially for travellers with unpredictable schedules. But what made our experience truly memorable was the warmth, efficiency, and attentiveness of the entire team.

Special thanks to Mr. Zakariya at the reception – always professional, welcoming, kind and very helpful. And a big appreciation for Juel from housekeeping – always polite and ready to assist. He always promptly brought our online food orders to the room with a smile – truly commendable service.

We opted for a room with a kitchen, which made our stay even more convenient. The kitchen had almost all the basic utensils – even a Mortar and Pestle (Hamandista), which was a thoughtful addition. However, one thing that was missing was a Vessel Holder (Sarashi). Including that would make the kitchen setup even more complete.

In the room all basic amenities were well provided, and the daily housekeeping service kept everything clean and comfortable. We especially appreciated that anything we needed was just a phone call away – the reception team responded immediately.

We noticed that only on some floors had the refrigerator outside at one corner of the floor. So, we specifically chose our room based on the fridge placement and the staff kindly accommodated our preferences.

A small suggestion: the bathroom tiles in the shower area get a bit slippery when wet, although it’s limited to just that section and not the entire bathroom. It would be great if this could be addressed to enhance safety.
Also, the exhaust fan feels slightly underpowered for the bathroom size.

Even though this is a late review, the hospitality and comfort we experienced are still fresh in our minds. We’re already planning to stay at Grand One Tower again on our next visit to Chennai.

A well-managed, peaceful and guest-friendly Business Class Hotel – highly recommended!

text.text:
I booked another hotel only it was not available to foreigners. After a long search I ended up at the Royal Palace Marina. The staff was super helpful to find us a great room, no efforts spared. We got the yellow room displayed in the pictures. Although the rooms are a bit dated and old, the stay was pleasant.

Pros:
- Good beds
-  Airconditioning
- Private shower
- Clean room
- Close to the beach
- Central location

Cons:
- Room looked dated compared to the picture
- Can be very noisy when people walk and talk around

Then again, it is a 2 star hotel so for the price it delivers great value if you take in account the location of the hotel and the many restaurants and shops around the hotel. Situated at the end of a long street it is also a good exit point for the metro and there are always tuk tuk's around to take you somewhere.

text.text:
I’m a longtime fan of Hilton Hotels, and our stay at Hilton Chennai was truly memorable! Although our visit was a little while ago, I felt it deserved a review on a platform like Google because of the exceptional experience we had.

Highlights from our stay:

* The breakfast buffet at Vasco’s was absolutely superb! The food was delicious, and the ambiance of the restaurant was warm and inviting. A special thank you to Executive Chef Shibu for his hospitality and for making us feel so welcome.
* The rooms were spacious, incredibly comfortable, and always smelled fresh — such a lovely touch that made our stay even more enjoyable.
* We especially loved the outdoor terrace in the evenings. My husband and I would unwind there with some amazing mocktails and great music — it quickly became our favorite spot.
* The Front Desk team was fantastic and went out of their way to assist us during check-in, especially since we were traveling with my elderly father and had a few special requests. Their care and professionalism really stood out.
* Location is good though there are no restaurants or malls immediately outside the hotel

Hilton Chennai truly knows how to make guests feel special, thanks to a team that embodies the true spirit of hospitality — warm, courteous, and attentive.

Note: My review comes a bit after our stay, so some aspects may have changed since then — but the wonderful memories remain just as vivid!

text.text: "I had the pleasure of being served by GOURAB.during my stay at Hilton Chennai, and their service was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I entered the restaurant, they greeted me warmly and made me feel truly welcome. Every dish was served with attention to detail, and they patiently explained the menu, offering thoughtful recommendations that perfectly matched my taste. Their attentiveness was remarkable — topping up water without being asked, checking in just the right amount, and always wearing a genuine smile. It’s rare to find someone who blends professionalism with such warmth and passion for their work. He turned an ordinary meal into a memorable dining experience, and they are a true credit to the hotel."

text.text:
The Perfect Grand Finale – A Royal Experience at The Leela Palace Chennai

As someone who planned this trip through South India for my wife and in-laws, I really wanted to end it on a high, somewhere luxurious, relaxing, and memorable for the whole family. The Leela Palace Chennai absolutely delivered on every front and then some. It was the perfect send-off to a beautiful journey.

We stayed in the Royal Club sea-facing rooms, and honestly, they were breathtaking. Watching the sun rise over the Bay of Bengal from our balcony each morning felt surreal, calm, peaceful, and something we’ll never forget. The rooms were beautifully appointed with every detail carefully thought out plush bedding (a pillow menu), luxurious bathrooms, and that view... just wow.

One of the best parts of the stay was access to the Royal Club Lounge* Each afternoon we’d make our way down for their high tea service, which had the perfect mix of savoury bites, sweets, and warm service. Then in the evening, it was time for cocktail hour, which quickly became our little daily ritual. Special shoutout to Esther, who took incredible care of us every single day. She remembered our preferences, always had a smile, and genuinely made us feel so welcome. Her kindness didn’t go unnoticed.

Breakfast every morning was another highlight. The buffet was extensive, from South Indian classics like dosas and idlis to international favourites like pancakes and made-to-order eggs. The staff were incredibly attentive, always making sure our table had what we needed, topping up coffee without being asked, and checking in to see if we were enjoying ourselves.

We also spent an evening at Library Blu, the hotel’s signature bar, and were seriously impressed. The space is beautifully designed, and the cocktails were out of this world, inventive, unique, and packed with flavour. The bartenders clearly take pride in their craft, and every drink was a work of art. We ended up trying a few different options just because everything was so good.

But what truly made this stay so exceptional was the people. I can’t thank Shomali, the manager, and Karthik, the butler services supervisor, enough. From pre-arrival coordination to last-minute requests, they made sure every little detail was handled seamlessly. They were always available, incredibly responsive, and genuinely cared about our experience. It honestly felt like we were staying in a palace, but being looked after by family, that’s the kind of warmth and service they provided.

As the person who organised this trip, I couldn’t have asked for a better way to end it. My in-laws were glowing with joy, my wife was relaxed and happy, and I got to sit back knowing we were all in the best hands possible. The Leela Palace Chennai exceeded every expectation.

Even the transport to the airport at the end of the trip was a delight, both our drivers went above and beyond to ensure a seamless and relaxing drive to get on our flights, only to be met at the airport by David who took care of our entire check in process.

If you’re looking for luxury that doesn’t feel stiff or impersonal, somewhere where the service is heartfelt, the food is incredible, and the setting is pure elegance, this is where you want to be.

text.text:
Having recently completed a week-long stay at The Leela Palace Chennai, I can confidently say this property redefines the standard for Indian luxury hospitality. Nestled along the serene Adyar estuary and overlooking the Bay of Bengal, the hotel is not just a place to stay—it is an immersive experience in refined grandeur, Southern tradition, and world-class service.

From the moment I arrived, I was enveloped in an atmosphere of regal splendor. The architectural elegance of the palace is striking, blending classical South Indian elements with contemporary luxury. High domes, ornate carvings, vast courtyards, and water features create an ambiance of timeless opulence. The check-in process was seamless and discreet, with warm traditional welcomes, refreshing towels, and jasmine garlands—a gesture that immediately set the tone for the days ahead.

I stayed in a Premier Sea View Room, and waking up to the stunning panoramic views of the Bay of Bengal was a highlight every morning. The room was spacious, tastefully furnished, and equipped with every imaginable amenity—plush bedding, a marble bathroom with a soaking tub, high-speed Wi-Fi, mood lighting, and a smart entertainment system. Turndown service was prompt and thoughtful, with personalized touches like hand-written notes and local sweets.

Dining at The Leela Palace is nothing short of a gastronomic journey. Spectra, the all-day dining restaurant, offered a global buffet with live counters and impeccable service. Jamavar, their Indian fine-dining restaurant, delivered an exquisite culinary exploration of regional Indian flavors. The chefs were more than willing to customize dishes to my preferences, and the sommelier curated excellent wine pairings with each course. Milled coffee and homemade dosas for breakfast became a daily ritual that I’ll truly miss.

One of the greatest strengths of this property is its people. Every staff member—from housekeeping to butlers, spa attendants to restaurant servers—radiated professionalism, warmth, and a deep pride in the Leela legacy. Service was anticipatory without being intrusive, and their attention to detail was flawless.

The spa deserves special mention. The ESPA therapies, tranquil setting, and seasoned therapists created a sanctuary of relaxation. I also used the pool and fitness center daily, both of which are beautifully maintained and offer calming views of the sea.

Security was unobtrusive yet reassuring, ideal for business leaders, celebrities, and international dignitaries who frequent the property. The concierge team was exceptional in organizing meetings, shopping experiences, and guided city tours tailored to my interests.

After a week at The Leela Palace Chennai, it’s clear why this hotel remains the gold standard for luxury in South India. It’s not merely the architecture or amenities that make it special, but the harmony of cultural authenticity, heartfelt hospitality, and attention to detail. Whether you’re a discerning traveler, a corporate guest, or a family seeking refined indulgence, The Leela Palace Chennai is an experience that will linger long after you’ve checked out.

text.text:
I wanted to provide a detailed review, so here it goes:

1. The rooms were fantastic, the service was outstanding, and the food was excellent.
2. Extremely friendly and helpful staff.

Now here are the things I wish they includeded:

1. In the bathroom a smaller stand for hanging our clothes is much appreciated, this is extremely helpful for shorter people.
2. A good tip to improve communication between clients and other departments will be to implement a WhatsApp chat system; like for example you should be able to place orders in the restaurant through a chat, it makes the whole process easier and it helps people who are unable to communicate verbally. This could be implemented in every department.
3. Hot water could be made available in the washroom.

Apart from these I really don't have any problem with the whole stay.
These aren't dealbreakers by any means but some quality changes.

text.text:
An outstanding experience from start to finish at the Hyatt Regency Chennai!

The hotel is in a prime location — central, convenient, and easy to get around. The property itself is spacious, clean, and very well maintained, with a strong sense of safety and comfort throughout.

The rooms are large, spotless, and thoughtfully designed, making for a truly relaxing stay. The dining options are fantastic, with multiple restaurants offering a great variety of delicious cuisines. The bar area is a great highlight, with live performances and a vibrant yet classy atmosphere that adds to the overall experience.

I also made use of the spa and gym facilities, both of which are top-notch. The spa services were excellent, and the gym is well-equipped and clean — perfect for staying on track while traveling.

What truly sets this hotel apart is the team of people working here. Every single staff member I interacted with — from the general manager and front desk team, to the concierge, waitresses, housekeeping staff, security guards, chefs, and kitchen team — was courteous, professional, and genuinely warm. You can tell there is a real culture of hospitality here. Everyone made an effort to ensure guests feel welcome, comfortable, and well cared for.

A big thank you to everyone at the Hyatt Regency Chennai for making my stay so memorable. Highly recommended whether you’re here for business or leisure!

Outstanding service, delectable food, and luxurious rooms!

Review: I recently had the pleasure of staying at Ilara Hotel and Spa Tada, and I must say that my experience was nothing short of exceptional. From the moment I stepped foot into the hotel, I was greeted with warm smiles and a welcoming atmosphere that set the tone for a perfect stay.

The service at Ilara Hotel and Spa Tada is truly outstanding. The staff went above and beyond to ensure that every need was met. They were attentive, professional, and always had a solution to any request. Whether it was arranging transportation, suggesting local attractions, or simply catering to my preferences, their commitment to customer satisfaction was truly remarkable.

Now let's talk about the food. The hotel's restaurant offered a wide range of delicious dishes that catered to various tastes. Each meal was a culinary delight, showcasing a blend of flavors that left my taste buds wanting more. The presentation was impeccable, and the attention to detail in each dish was evident. Whether I dined in the elegant restaurant or enjoyed a meal at the Japanese restaurant , the experience was always exceptional.

Lastly, the rooms at Ilara Hotel and Spa Tada were luxurious and comfortable. The attention to detail in the design and amenities provided a true sense of relaxation. The well-appointed room had all the modern comforts one could ask for, and the view from the balcony was simply breathtaking. I felt pampered and rejuvenated throughout my stay.

Overall, my experience at Ilara Hotel and Spa Tada was nothing short of superb. From the outstanding service, delectable food, to the luxurious rooms, every aspect exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend this hotel and spa to anyone looking for a memorable and luxurious retreat. It truly is a haven for relaxation and indulgence.

text.text:
The Holiday Inn Chennai Omr It Expressway is an excellent choice for travelers looking for comfortable accommodation and great amenities. As an IHG hotel, it offers a high standard of service and hospitality that is sure to make your stay enjoyable.

The hotel rooms are spacious and well-appointed, featuring modern furnishings and all the necessary amenities for a comfortable stay. The beds are comfortable, ensuring a good night's sleep after a long day of exploring or business meetings. The rooms are also equipped with flat-screen TVs, coffee makers, and high-speed internet access, allowing you to stay connected and entertained throughout your stay.

One standout feature of the Holiday Inn Chennai Omr It Expressway is its exceptional staff. The hotel staff are friendly, courteous, and always willing to go the extra mile to ensure your needs are met. Whether you have questions about local attractions, need assistance with bookings, or require any other help, the staff are knowledgeable and eager to assist.

The hotel facilities are also impressive. There is a well-equipped fitness center where you can work out and stay in shape during your stay. Additionally, the hotel features a swimming pool, perfect for a refreshing dip or some relaxation under the sun. If you're traveling for business, the hotel offers meeting and conference facilities, making it an ideal choice for corporate travelers.

When it comes to dining options, the Holiday Inn Chennai Omr It Expressway has you covered. The on-site restaurant offers a variety of delicious dishes, ranging from traditional Indian cuisine to international favorites. The restaurant staff are attentive, ensuring a pleasant dining experience.

The hotel's location is another advantage. Situated on the IT Expressway, it is conveniently located for business travelers visiting the many technology parks and corporate offices in the area. The hotel is also within close proximity to shopping malls, entertainment venues, and tourist attractions, making it easy to explore the city during your stay.

In terms of value, the Holiday Inn Chennai Omr It Expressway offers a great balance between comfort and affordability. The rates are reasonable considering the quality of service and facilities available. Whether you're traveling for business or pleasure, you can expect a pleasant and enjoyable stay at this IHG hotel.

Overall, the Holiday Inn Chennai Omr It Expressway is a fantastic choice for travelers seeking a comfortable hotel with great amenities. From its spacious rooms and friendly staff to its convenient location and excellent dining options, this IHG hotel has everything you need for a memorable stay in Chennai.

text.text:
We had the pleasure of staying at Grand One Tower – a true Business Class Hotel in Chennai – not just once, but three times last year, and every time felt like a home away from home.

Their 24×7 check-in and check-out facility is a huge advantage, especially for travellers with unpredictable schedules. But what made our experience truly memorable was the warmth, efficiency, and attentiveness of the entire team.

Special thanks to Mr. Zakariya at the reception – always professional, welcoming, kind and very helpful. And a big appreciation for Juel from housekeeping – always polite and ready to assist. He always promptly brought our online food orders to the room with a smile – truly commendable service.

We opted for a room with a kitchen, which made our stay even more convenient. The kitchen had almost all the basic utensils – even a Mortar and Pestle (Hamandista), which was a thoughtful addition. However, one thing that was missing was a Vessel Holder (Sarashi). Including that would make the kitchen setup even more complete.

In the room all basic amenities were well provided, and the daily housekeeping service kept everything clean and comfortable. We especially appreciated that anything we needed was just a phone call away – the reception team responded immediately.

We noticed that only on some floors had the refrigerator outside at one corner of the floor. So, we specifically chose our room based on the fridge placement and the staff kindly accommodated our preferences.

A small suggestion: the bathroom tiles in the shower area get a bit slippery when wet, although it’s limited to just that section and not the entire bathroom. It would be great if this could be addressed to enhance safety.
Also, the exhaust fan feels slightly underpowered for the bathroom size.

Even though this is a late review, the hospitality and comfort we experienced are still fresh in our minds. We’re already planning to stay at Grand One Tower again on our next visit to Chennai.

A well-managed, peaceful and guest-friendly Business Class Hotel – highly recommended!

A business trip & Stay at Radisson Hotel Chennai.

I recently had the pleasure of staying at the Radisson Hotel in Chennai, and I must say that it was a delightful experience. From the moment I entered the hotel to the moment I checked out, I was impressed by the level of service, the comfortable accommodations, and the overall ambiance of the property.

I must recommend Shreya Banerjee, who helped me to arrange a corporate tie-up with my company & helped me to conduct the conference with ease & arrange the accommodation & conference room within the budget.

The check-in process was swift and efficient, and the staff was incredibly welcoming and courteous. They made me feel like a valued guest from the very beginning, and their professionalism was evident throughout my stay. Whether I had questions about the local area or needed assistance with my room, the staff was always ready to help.

My stay at the Radisson Hotel Chennai was a memorable one. The friendly and attentive staff, comfortable accommodations, and convenient location all contributed to a positive experience. While there were a few minor areas where improvements could be made, such as increasing the natural light in the rooms, these did not significantly detract from the overall quality of my stay. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to fellow travellers visiting Chennai and look forward to returning in the future

text.text:
An Amazing Stay at Radisson Blu GRT Chennai – Truly Felt Like Home

I recently stayed at Radisson Blu GRT Chennai for three months, and I can confidently say it was one of the best experiences I’ve ever had. From the warm welcome to the heartfelt goodbyes, everything about this hotel made me feel at home.

Comfortable and Cozy Rooms
The rooms were spacious, beautifully designed, and always kept spotless. A special shoutout to Vinod from housekeeping, who went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect. His attention to detail and friendly demeanor really stood out and made my stay even more comfortable. Also Bala who previously worked there helped me a lot.

Delicious Dining Experience
The food was exceptional! Dining at Ministry of Chutneys was a real treat every single time, and much of that was thanks to Andrew. He wasn’t just someone assisting with my dining experience; he became a true friend during my stay. Andrew’s energy, enthusiasm, and warm conversations made every meal special. Whether it was suggesting the perfect dish, checking in to make sure I was happy, or just having a friendly chat, he made me feel genuinely cared for. His positivity and passion for his work truly shined, making dining one of the highlights of my stay. The chefs, too, were amazing—always friendly and skilled at creating delicious meals that I thoroughly enjoyed. (Pomegranate Juice 😁)

Front Office and General Support
Santhosham, Dinesh, and Baskaran were fantastic throughout my stay, offering support and assistance whenever needed. Their professionalism and willingness to help added so much to the overall experience.

Front Office Excellence
A heartfelt thank you to Miss Sherin from the front office, whose friendly and professional demeanor stood out from check-in to check-out. She ensured every aspect of my stay was smooth and hassle-free, always ready to assist with a warm smile. Her thoughtful approach and dedication made me feel truly valued as a guest. Sherin was not just a staff member but a wonderful friend throughout my stay.

Fitness & Wellness
The gym was fantastic, and I have to thank Suthakumar and the other trainers for making my workouts fun and effective. They were always professional, encouraging, and approachable, which made it so much easier to stay on top of my fitness routine.

Wonderful Security Team
Ravikumar and his team at security were incredible. Ravikumar, in particular, greeted me every day with a warm smile and such genuine friendliness—it really made a difference. You can tell the team takes pride in creating a welcoming and safe environment for everyone.

Overall Experience
My stay at Radisson Blu GRT Chennai was unforgettable. The team here goes above and beyond to make you feel comfortable, cared for, and truly at home. From the delicious meals to the thoughtful service and warm smiles from every staff member, this place is a perfect mix of luxury and heart.

Special thanks to Sherin, Andrew (who was like a best friend and a bundle of energy), all the amazing chefs, Santhosham, Dinesh, Baskaran, Vinod, Suthakumar, Ravikumar, and his team for making my stay so memorable. Whether or not your name is mentioned here, I want to say that everyone I interacted with was absolutely fantastic. Your collective efforts truly made my stay extraordinary.

I’d recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Chennai without a second thought.

highlightedText.text: "The hotel provided a truly memorable experience that was worth every penny."

text.text:
I recently had the pleasure of staying at Radisson Blue Egmore Chennai for a four-day trip, and I must say, it exceeded all my expectations from the moment I stepped into the premises, I was greeted with a warm and inviting atmosphere. The hotel's amenities were top-notch, providing everything I needed for a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

The reception staffs, particularly Shibu the dining staff were incredibly friendly and efficient. They made the check-in process seamless and were always available to assist with any queries or requests I had throughout my stay. Their professionalism and dedication truly made a difference in my overall experience.

Now, let's talk about the food! The hotel boasted some of the best food I have ever tasted, rivaling even the finest 5-star standard restaurants. The variety and quality of the dishes were exceptional, catering to a range of culinary preferences. I was thoroughly impressed with the presentation, taste, and attention to detail in every meal I had.

The hotel staff baggage carrying staff, wallet parking staffs and cleaning staff including the reception staff and the ladies responsible for maintaining the cleanliness of the rooms, were outstanding. The bed sheets and towels were of the highest quality, providing a luxurious and comfortable sleep experience. The cleaning staff ensured that my room was always spotless and well-maintained, creating a pleasant and hygienic environment.
The amenities, especially the swimming pool and gym, played a major role in maintaining fitness enthusiasm. With state-of-the-art equipment and a variety of exercise options, the gym provided a perfect space for individuals to work on their strength and endurance. The swimming pool, on the other hand, offered a refreshing and low-impact way to stay active and improve my health Additionally, the availability of these amenities made it convenient for people who wanted to incorporate exercise into their daily routines, ultimately contributing to their overall well-being.

Overall, my stay at Radisson Blue Egmore Chennai was nothing short of exceptional. The hotel provided a truly memorable experience that was worth every penny. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious and enjoyable stay in Chennai.
Lastly, I would like to suggest that you ask guests upon arrival whether they would prefer smoking or non-smoking rooms according to their requirement.

text.text:
Having stayed at Hiltons across the globe, the Hilton in Chennai was our natural first choice. Strategically perched in the heart of corporate Chennai, the location is ideal — not just for leisure but for business travellers as well. From the moment you enter, you're greeted with that familiar Hilton charm — the signature scent, gleaming chandeliers, elegant flooring, and timeless interiors. But what truly sets this property apart are the genuinely warm smiles that welcome you — the kind that makes you feel right at home.

Rooms: Contemporary and smart, with a perfect blend of homely warmth and upscale aesthetics. Of course, the much-talked-about Hilton Comfort Bed lived up to its reputation with deep sleep guaranteed.

F&B: For food lovers, Hilton Chennai is a hotspot. Their curated food specials, like the Friday seafood buffet and Rajasthani food festivals, are favourites with locals and guests alike. Their stylish, vintage jazz-inspired bar and the buzzing rooftop club by the pool only add to the charm. I recommend increasing menu real estate for local cuisine, supported by staff training on each dish. The regional offerings are unique, and this is a competitive edge few hotels in the area currently doing not have. What made our stay truly memorable was the gold-standard service — from the efficient front desk to the magical room service team.

Special callout to the front desk, the security staff (always with a namasthe and smile), room service Magic and house keeping staff. Shantanu from the front desk was warm and brought quick resolution to challenges. Hilton Chennai — you were a delight. We’ll be back.
